2300760.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300760
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 001
2300760.text: 'Uqba ibn 'Amir reported that he heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "If someone has three daughters and is patient with them and clothes them from his wealth, they will be a shield against the Fire for him."

2300770.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300770
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 002
2300770.text: Ibn 'Abbas reported that he heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "There is no Muslim who has two daughters and takes good care of them but that he will enter the Garden."

2300780.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300780
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 003
2300780.text: Jabir ibn 'Abdullah reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Anyone who has three daughters and provides for them, clothes them and shows mercy to them will definitely enter the Garden." A man from the people said, "And two daughters, Messenger of Allah?" He said, "And two."

2300790.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300790
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 004
2300790.text: Abu Sa'id al-Khudri said that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "No one has three daughters or three sisters and is good to them but that he will enter the Garden."

2300800.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300800
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 005
2300800.text: Musa ibn 'Ali reported that the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "Shall I show you the greatest sadaqa (or one of the greatest forms of sadaqa)?" He replied, "Yes, indeed, Messenger of Allah!" He went on, "To provide for your daughter when she is returned to you and you are her sole source of provision."

2300810.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300810
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 006
2300810.text: Suraqa ibn Ju'shum reported that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said the like of previous hadith.

2300820.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300820
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 007
2300820.text: Al-Miqdam ibn Ma'dikarib heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say, "What you feed yourself is sadaqa for you. What you feed your child is sadaqa for you. What you feed your wife is sadaqa is for you. What you feed your servant is sadaqa for you."

2300830.reference:
Reference  : Al-Adab Al-Mufrad 2300830
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 008
2300830.text: It is reported that there was a man who had daughters who was with Ibn 'Umar when he wished that his daughters were dead. Ibn 'Umar became angry and said, "While you are providing for them!"
